company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).
 
More information about Capita Pte Ltd is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp.

company_desc:
Since 1933, Bee Cheng Hiang has promoted Singapore food culture by introducing Bakkwa (barbecued meat) to the nation and countries across the globe. Bee Cheng Hiang is a heritage awarded brand and one of the iconic representation of Singapore. It is a must-try delicacy for anyone visiting the country.



 



As a market leader in the barbecued meat industry, we consistently ensure high quality standards in nutrition and hygiene. We also continually invest in product research and technology innovation in order to gain and maintain our competitive advantage. Our bakkwa boasts the highest quality of meat and it contains the best natural ingredients with no added MSG, preservatives and artificial flavoring.



 



As in all dynamic organisations, we believe that employees are the greatest asset. We are always committed to enhance the growth of our employees' performance and their ability to work effectively as part of a team through progressive training and development.



 



Bee Cheng Hiang now employs more than 3000 staff with over 360 retail outlets across Singapore, Malaysia, China, Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan, Korea, Japan, Indonesia, Cambodia, Vietnam, Philippines and Thailand.





Our Corporate Vision:

To be Asia’s leading food company providing quality products and services to the global market

 



Our Awards and Achievements:

• Singapore ISO9002 Certified since 1997

• Singapore HACCP Certified since 1999

• Singapore Promising Brand Award (2002 - 2005)

• Retail Courtesy Gold Award (2003)

• Singapore Most Popular Brand Award (2003, 2004)

• Excellence Service Awards (2003-2006, 2014)

• Singapore Food Safety Partners Status with AVA (Agri-food & Veterinary Authority) since 2005

• Singapore Prestige Brand Award - Regional Brand Winner (2009)

• Singapore Prestige Brand Award - Most Popular Brand Winner (2009)

Job Title: Accountant / Senior Finance Executive (Accounts Payable) (6-Month Contract)
Job Description:
Job Responsibilities
 
You will be responsible for the monthly AP closing and reporting for various accounting entities within the business unit, including the review of invoices, journal vouchers, schedules, batch payments, staff claims and close adherence to company’s policies and guidelines. You will need to ensure compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements including statistical reports to government agencies. You will need to prepare variance analysis and be involved in annual budgeting and forecasting. You will also need to liaise with auditors and tax agents for year-end audits and tax filing/compliance. You will also be involved in ad-hoc operational projects, including conducting credit review for selection of vendors, testing of SAP system etc, from time to time.
 
Job Requirements
 
You should be a qualified Accountant who possesses a Degree in Accountancy or ACCA or its equivalent with at least 4 years’ relevant hands-on accounting experience. To succeed in this role, you should possess good knowledge in SFRS and well-versed in Excel. Ability to work meticulously in a fast-paced environment is critical. You should also be a good team player, driven, independent, possess initiative and have the ability to deliver quality work within a stipulated timeline. You should also possess a good working attitude, good analytical skills and a strong sense of responsibility. Candidates with prior SAP and real estate knowledge will have an added advantage.
 
Interested applicants, please submit your resume online via 
APPLY Now
.
 
(We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Mapletree Investments Pte Ltd shall not be responsible or liable to any recruitment firm or agency in connection with the receipt of any unsolicited information on any prospective candidate.)
company_desc:
Mapletree is a leading real estate development, investment and capital management company headquartered in Singapore.

		

			

				 

			

				Mapletree Investments Pte Ltd (Mapletree) is focused on delivering value to its stakeholders through its business model that maximises capital efficiency. In executing a business strategy that combines the roles of real estate development, investment and capital management, Mapletree has generated consistently good returns to its stakeholders, and established a track record for building award-winning development projects across various real estate classes.

			

				 

			

				As at 31 March 2018, Mapletree owns and manages S$46.3 billion of office, retail, logistics, industrial, residential, corporate housing / serviced apartment, and student accommodation properties. Presently, Mapletree manages four Singapore-listed real estate investment trusts (REITs) and six private real estate funds, which hold a diverse portfolio of assets in Asia Pacific, the United Kingdom (UK) and the United States (US). The Group has also established an extensive network of offices in Singapore, Australia, China, Hong Kong SAR, India, Japan, Malaysia, South Korea, the UK, the US and Vietnam.

			

				 

			

				Mapletree’s portfolio includes award-winning properties in Singapore such as VivoCity, Mapletree Business City and STT Tai Seng 1, as well as mixed-use developments in the region such as Mapletree Business City Shanghai and VivoCity Shanghai, and Nanhai Business City in China.

			

				 

			

				Visit our website at http://www.mapletree.com.sg/ to find out more.

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).

company_desc: We are providing audit, accounting, tax and secretarial services. We offer one-stop professionalism, convenience, and peace of mind to local and foreign  entrepreneurs to set up and conduct business in Singapore and the region.

Job Title: Accountant / Senior Finance Executive (Accounts Payable) (6-Month Contract)
Job Description:
Job Responsibilities
 
You will be responsible for the monthly AP closing and reporting for various accounting entities within the business unit, including the review of invoices, journal vouchers, schedules, batch payments, staff claims and close adherence to company’s policies and guidelines. You will need to ensure compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements including statistical reports to government agencies. You will need to prepare variance analysis and be involved in annual budgeting and forecasting. You will also need to liaise with auditors and tax agents for year-end audits and tax filing/compliance. You will also be involved in ad-hoc operational projects, including conducting credit review for selection of vendors, testing of SAP system etc, from time to time.
 
Job Requirements
 
You should be a qualified Accountant who possesses a Degree in Accountancy or ACCA or its equivalent with at least 4 years’ relevant hands-on accounting experience. To succeed in this role, you should possess good knowledge in SFRS and well-versed in Excel. Ability to work meticulously in a fast-paced environment is critical. You should also be a good team player, driven, independent, possess initiative and have the ability to deliver quality work within a stipulated timeline. You should also possess a good working attitude, good analytical skills and a strong sense of responsibility. Candidates with prior SAP and real estate knowledge will have an added advantage.
 
Interested applicants, please submit your resume online via 
APPLY Now
.
 
(We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Mapletree Investments Pte Ltd shall not be responsible or liable to any recruitment firm or agency in connection with the receipt of any unsolicited information on any prospective candidate.)
company_desc:
Mapletree is a leading real estate development, investment and capital management company headquartered in Singapore.

		

			

				 

			

				Mapletree Investments Pte Ltd (Mapletree) is focused on delivering value to its stakeholders through its business model that maximises capital efficiency. In executing a business strategy that combines the roles of real estate development, investment and capital management, Mapletree has generated consistently good returns to its stakeholders, and established a track record for building award-winning development projects across various real estate classes.

			

				 

			

				As at 31 March 2018, Mapletree owns and manages S$46.3 billion of office, retail, logistics, industrial, residential, corporate housing / serviced apartment, and student accommodation properties. Presently, Mapletree manages four Singapore-listed real estate investment trusts (REITs) and six private real estate funds, which hold a diverse portfolio of assets in Asia Pacific, the United Kingdom (UK) and the United States (US). The Group has also established an extensive network of offices in Singapore, Australia, China, Hong Kong SAR, India, Japan, Malaysia, South Korea, the UK, the US and Vietnam.

			

				 

			

				Mapletree’s portfolio includes award-winning properties in Singapore such as VivoCity, Mapletree Business City and STT Tai Seng 1, as well as mixed-use developments in the region such as Mapletree Business City Shanghai and VivoCity Shanghai, and Nanhai Business City in China.

			

				 

			

				Visit our website at http://www.mapletree.com.sg/ to find out more.

Job Description:
The JMP Division of SAS is successful and growing, which means we are in the market for smart people to join our sales team. At JMP, we offer very competitive income, work/life balance and career growth opportunities. We believe people is our most important asset. As a JMP Accounts Executive role you will be responsible for the sales of JMP product family to existing customers and new accounts in Southeast Asia.
Responsibilities will include:
• Sells software, solutions and services to current and prospective customers; works with other sales/pre-sales/domain/personnel to position and leverage sales opportunities to acquire, grow and retain customers within assigned territory.
• Fulfills wide range of requests for information from prospective customers. Qualifies level of opportunity and resources required.
• Prospects within a territory or account to uncover business needs.
• Implements aspects of territory and account management and development; identifies accounts with high "close" potential, qualifies, advances opportunity through milestone steps of sales cycle and forecast time frames to close business within Orion.
• Works closely with pre-sales resources and executives to facilitate timely response to highly qualified, high revenue potential opportunities.
• Prepares standard quotations and proposal information as needed; works with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for delivery services.
• Follows up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.
• Develops a basic understanding of company pricing, licensing procedures and approvals matrix.
• Fully utilizes account planning process and tools (Account Plans and Opportunity Plans within BASE).
• Performs other duties, as assigned.
 
Requirements
Essential
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering/ statistic or related background
• 3+ years of successful experience in sales of computer software, hardware or IT solutions (such as ERP, CRM, Data warehouse and etc)
• Good communication through phone and email
• Willing to learn and to grow to next level of career
 
Additional
• Knowledge of software acquisition cycles
• Written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills and organizational skills
• Ability to work independently as well as part of a team comprised of a Pre-sales consultant, Account Manager
• Ability to sell training and service
• Ability to quickly build trust and maintain long term relationship with existing accounts
• Ability to build trust through phone call, email and other on-line channels
company_desc:
SAS is the leader in analytics. Through innovative analytics solutions, business intelligence and data management software and services, SAS helps customers at more than 75,000 sites improve performance and deliver value by making better decisions faster. Since 1976, SAS has been giving customers around the world THE POWER TO KNOW®.
 
To view current vacancies at SAS, please visit us at: http://www.sas.com/en_us/careers.html

company_desc:
Keppel Land
 is the property arm of the Keppel Group, one of Singapore's largest multinational groups with key businesses in offshore and marine, infrastructure as well as property.

	

		 

	

		One of Asia's premier property companies, Keppel Land is recognised for its sterling portfolio of award-winning residential developments and investment-grade commercial properties as well as high standards of corporate governance and transparency. The Company is geographically diversified in Asia, with Singapore and China as its core markets as well as Vietnam and Indonesia as its growth markets. It has two listed companies, one each in the Philippines and Thailand. Keppel Land focuses on a two-pronged strategy of property development for sale and property fund management.

company_desc:
Shingda is a local civil engineering firm incorporated in 1986. Being a specialist contractor in pipeline works, Shingda obtained most of its projects through open tender for Government Project. Our customer includes Public Utilities Board of Singapore and Changi Airport Group.

	 

	Shingda is accorded the Singapore Quality Class – Star, and Singapore Innovation Class and is certified to ISO 9000, ISO 14000, OSHAS 18000 and Biz Safe – Star. With staff strength of close to 400 and a construction fleet of more than a hundred, professionalism, quality and efficiency are our key business attributes in propelling our business towards sustained excellence.

company_desc:
At the Forefront of Education Innovation



Hwa Chong Institution (HCI) is Singapore's premier independent school, with a rich history of over 90 years. HCI was the first mega-school in Singapore to offer six-year 'through-train' Integrated Programme (IP).



The Institution offers a host of MOE and school-based Talent Development Programmes. They include the Science and Math Talent Programme; Humanities Programme; Bicultural Studies Programme; Language Elective (Chinese) Programme; Art Elective Programme; as well as Research and Enrichment Programmes with both local and overseas institutions of learning.



In 2009, HCI was featured as one of the world's most innovative schools by the South China Morning Post, Hong Kong's premier English daily. Job Description:
The JMP Division of SAS is successful and growing, which means we are in the market for smart people to join our sales team. At JMP, we offer very competitive income, work/life balance and career growth opportunities. We believe people is our most important asset. As a JMP Accounts Executive role you will be responsible for the sales of JMP product family to existing customers and new accounts in Southeast Asia.
Responsibilities will include:
• Sells software, solutions and services to current and prospective customers; works with other sales/pre-sales/domain/personnel to position and leverage sales opportunities to acquire, grow and retain customers within assigned territory.
• Fulfills wide range of requests for information from prospective customers. Qualifies level of opportunity and resources required.
• Prospects within a territory or account to uncover business needs.
• Implements aspects of territory and account management and development; identifies accounts with high "close" potential, qualifies, advances opportunity through milestone steps of sales cycle and forecast time frames to close business within Orion.
• Works closely with pre-sales resources and executives to facilitate timely response to highly qualified, high revenue potential opportunities.
• Prepares standard quotations and proposal information as needed; works with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for delivery services.
• Follows up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.
• Develops a basic understanding of company pricing, licensing procedures and approvals matrix.
• Fully utilizes account planning process and tools (Account Plans and Opportunity Plans within BASE).
• Performs other duties, as assigned.
 
Requirements
Essential
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering/ statistic or related background
• 3+ years of successful experience in sales of computer software, hardware or IT solutions (such as ERP, CRM, Data warehouse and etc)
• Good communication through phone and email
• Willing to learn and to grow to next level of career
 
Additional
• Knowledge of software acquisition cycles
• Written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills and organizational skills
• Ability to work independently as well as part of a team comprised of a Pre-sales consultant, Account Manager
• Ability to sell training and service
• Ability to quickly build trust and maintain long term relationship with existing accounts
• Ability to build trust through phone call, email and other on-line channels

Job Description:
Job Purpose
 
This role supports the Finance Shared Services - Accounts Receivable team in the following:
Oversee operation matters of Payment Enquiry team who are handling enquiries via incoming calls and emails from patients / corporate customer and ensure timely closure.  Improve patients’ experience and satisfaction and garner Compliments from patients.
Communicate withhospital staff (Business Office, Service Quality, Wards and Clinics) to manage complex complaints or feedback.
Services Improvements - work with respective team supervisors on staffs training, learning and development and also looking at ways to improve quality of work life balance for staff.  Work with external vendors on software Projects to re-design work process.
Main Roles and responsibilities
Supervise Payment Enquiry staffs attending to incoming calls and emails and ensure timely closure.
Attend Review meetings with respective Business Office heads for Self- Paying and Corporate customers for Accounts Receivable related matters
Manage complex complaints & feedback and work with colleague from hospitals for satisfactory closure.
Supervisory duties, engagement of staff and achieving section goals and objective.
Requirements
Minimum Bachelor Degree in any discipline
5 year experience in AR Management and in a managerial position. Experience in Customer Service and Call Centre is preferred but not essential.
Strong data analysis skill.
Preferably IT-savvy
Excellent spoken and written communication skill
company_desc:
NHG’s vision is “Adding years of healthy life”. This vision departs from merely healing the sick to the more challenging and infinitely more rewarding task of preventing illness and preserving health and quality of life.
	

		 

	

		NHG is a leader in public healthcare in Singapore, recognised at home and abroad for the quality of its medical expertise and facilities.

	

		 

	

		

			Care is provided through an integrated network of nine primary healthcare polyclinics, acute care and tertiary hospitals, national specialty centres and business divisions. Together, they bring a rich legacy of more than 340 years of medical expertise to our philosophy of patient-centric care.

		

			 

		

			By designing accessible and seamless healthcare services around patients' needs, NHG ensures that patient care is fully coordinated within the cluster and is also extended to a high level of collaboration with other healthcare providers at home and abroad.

About Kelly Services®
As a global leader in providing workforce solutions, Kelly Services, Inc. (Nasdaq: KELYA, KELYB) and its subsidiaries, offer a comprehensive array of outsourcing and consulting services as well as world-class staffing on a temporary, temporary-to-hire, and direct-hire basis.  Kelly® directly employs nearly 500,000 people around the world in addition to having a role in connecting thousands more with work through its global network of talent suppliers and partners. 
 
For more than 35 years, Kelly in Singapore has been partnering the finest local companies, key government agencies as well as some of the world’s most respected multinational companies to deliver the best talent in the market. Job Title: Finance Officer/Senior (Accounts/Fullsets, Client Accounting) - 1 Year Contract
Company:

Job Description:
Job responsibilities:
• Responsible for keeping full set of accounts which includes, account payables, account receivables, general accounting and fixed assets processes
• Prepare and/or review monthly GL, balance sheet, profit or loss statement, audit schedules and follow up on outstanding items
• Manage accurate and timely closing of books for the month and prepare financial reports
• Support the clients in all relevant Financial Reporting requirements, analysis, reports and deliverables.
• Manage/ Support audit within stipulated timelines
• Manage/ Support ad-hoc Finance/Accounting related projects/ initiatives, as and when required.   
 
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor’s Degree / Diploma in Accountancy, Finance, and/or ACCA or other professional accounting qualifications (eg. Chartered Accountant)
• At least 1 year of working experience in Finance/Accounting Operations, preferably in shared services environment
• Good unstanding of Finance/ Accounting concepts
• Proficiency in PC skills, Microsoft Office
• Good written and verbal communication skills
• Good analysis, organizational and planning, problem solving skills, proactive and self-motivated with ability to multi-task
• Team player and enjoy working with variety of clients
• Independent, confident and customer-oriented disposition
• Meticulous and organized with high level of accuracy
• Able to handle high volume of transactions
• Entry-level candidates are welcomed to apply

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).
 
More information about Capita Pte Ltd is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp.

Keppel Land
 is the property arm of the Keppel Group, one of Singapore's largest multinational groups with key businesses in offshore and marine, infrastructure as well as property.

Company:
Capita Pte Ltd – Temp & Contract

Job Description:
ACCOUNTS OFFICER                
Location : Changi North way
Working hours: Mon – Fri 8.30am – 5.30pm
Salary up $4000
6 months contract 
                        
The Job:
•
 Management reporting and analysis
o Support in the accurate completion and timely submission of all monthly, quarterly, year end and adhoc reporting requirements for Corporate Office and internal stakeholders for 2-3 legal entities.
o Assist in preparation of internal management booklet, reports to facilitate decision making or performance tracking; and adhoc reporting needs.
• Budgeting and Planning
o Provide support in preparation and development of all budgeting or strategy planning needs 
o Prepare and consolidate budget schedules fulfilling both internal and Corporate requirements
o Assist with preparation of budget presentation slides
• 
Activity Based Costing and Profitability Analysis
o Assist in the preparation of monthly Activity Based Costing for Total Company

• 
Business Partnering and Support
o Provide support to the various Segments stakeholders together with the Financial Analyst/ reporting Lead.
• 
Operational Accounting
o Provide support and management of selected Key Clients’ payables and billables portfolio
• Lead or proactive participation in project initiatives or process improvements such as Finance Transformatiion ..etc.
• Assist in any other ad hoc duties or projects as assigned by the Company.
 
Requirements:
• Degree in Accountancy / Finance / Business Administration(Accountancy) and/ or equivalent Professional Accounting 
• Minimum 2 to 4 years of relevant experience in similar capacity
• Strong technical competencies in both profit & loss and balance sheet items, and financial analysis
• Good working knowledge in SAP COPA and BPC
• Excellent IT skills in Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and Word
• Knowledge of Tableau would be an advantage

company_desc:
Essilor is a multinational company with its Corporate Headquarters in Paris, France. Singapore is the regional headquarters for Asia Pacific, Middle-East, Russia and Africa.

	

		 

	

		Essilor is the world leader for corrective lenses. The success of the group, which is present in more than 100 countries, is the result of a strategy that has been driven by innovation for more than 160 years. From design to manufacture, the group develops a wide range of lenses to correct and protect eyesight.

	

		 

	

		Its mission is to enable everyone in the world to see well using lenses tailored to their needs. The group therefore devotes 150 million euros a year on research and development to offer increasingly efficient products.

	

		 

	

		4.2 billion people in the world today need visual correction and 2.4 billion people do not receive it. Enabling the greatest number of people to see properly to improve their quality of life has been our mission for more than 160 years.
		

			 

		

			Ophthalmic lenses provide an irreplaceable service, and meet a basic need in life. Our business includes a very important human dimension, along with high standards in quality and innovation.

Job Description:
The JMP Division of SAS is successful and growing, which means we are in the market for smart people to join our sales team. At JMP, we offer very competitive income, work/life balance and career growth opportunities. We believe people is our most important asset. As a JMP Accounts Executive role you will be responsible for the sales of JMP product family to existing customers and new accounts in Southeast Asia.
Responsibilities will include:
• Sells software, solutions and services to current and prospective customers; works with other sales/pre-sales/domain/personnel to position and leverage sales opportunities to acquire, grow and retain customers within assigned territory.
• Fulfills wide range of requests for information from prospective customers. Qualifies level of opportunity and resources required.
• Prospects within a territory or account to uncover business needs.
• Implements aspects of territory and account management and development; identifies accounts with high "close" potential, qualifies, advances opportunity through milestone steps of sales cycle and forecast time frames to close business within Orion.
• Works closely with pre-sales resources and executives to facilitate timely response to highly qualified, high revenue potential opportunities.
• Prepares standard quotations and proposal information as needed; works with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for delivery services.
• Follows up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.
• Develops a basic understanding of company pricing, licensing procedures and approvals matrix.
• Fully utilizes account planning process and tools (Account Plans and Opportunity Plans within BASE).
• Performs other duties, as assigned.
 
Requirements
Essential
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering/ statistic or related background
• 3+ years of successful experience in sales of computer software, hardware or IT solutions (such as ERP, CRM, Data warehouse and etc)
• Good communication through phone and email
• Willing to learn and to grow to next level of career
 
Additional
• Knowledge of software acquisition cycles
• Written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills and organizational skills
• Ability to work independently as well as part of a team comprised of a Pre-sales consultant, Account Manager
• Ability to sell training and service

Since 1976, SAS has been giving customers around the world THE POWER TO KNOW®.

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities
 
Perform intercompany vendor/customer balances from SAP and prepare Reconciliation Report
Analyse and reconcile accounts, and prepare GL Account Analysis and Reconciliation Reports including foreign currency accounting
Perform Month-end, quarter-end and year-end closing
Monthly expense variance analysis
Assist in preparation of GST submissions to IRAS and corporate tax schedule
Ensure accuracy of financial statements and compliance to internal policies
Any other duties and responsibilities as may be reasonably requested by your immediate supervisor / the head of department from time to time
Job Requirements
 
Diploma from Accountancy / ACCA Level 2
At least 2 years of experience in General Ledger (full set of accounts)
Preferably have experience in SAP system
company_desc:
Keppel Land
 is the property arm of the Keppel Group, one of Singapore's largest multinational groups with key businesses in offshore and marine, infrastructure as well as property.

	

		 

	

		One of Asia's premier property companies, Keppel Land is recognised for its sterling portfolio of award-winning residential developments and investment-grade commercial properties as well as high standards of corporate governance and transparency. The Company is geographically diversified in Asia, with Singapore and China as its core markets as well as Vietnam and Indonesia as its growth markets. It has two listed companies, one each in the Philippines and Thailand. Keppel Land focuses on a two-pronged strategy of property development for sale and property fund management.

Company: Bee Cheng Hiang Hup Chong Foodstuff Pte Ltd
Job Description:
We are looking for 
enthusiastic
 individuals to support our Accounts Team by assisting in:




	
Daily operations of the accounting functions (Partial set of accounts, AP, AR, GL)

	
Audit, corporate tax/GST filing and other compliance matters

	
Monthly reports and closing of accounts

	
Regular cash audits and inventory stocktakes at our retail outlets

	
Financial related administrative matters





 



Job Requirements:




	
Diploma in Accounting or its equivalent

	
Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Accounting applications

	
No working experience required as on-the-job training will be provided

	
Able to multi-task, conscientious, tactful and willing to learn new skills

	
Honest and Hardworking

	
Organized and has the ability to work under pressure

	
Able to work independently and committed to work

	
Able to stay focused on the details of the job to ensure accuracy





 



Embark on a career with excellent opportunities to enhance your learning and exposure!
company_desc:
Since 1933, Bee Cheng Hiang has promoted Singapore food culture by introducing Bakkwa (barbecued meat) to the nation and countries across the globe. Bee Cheng Hiang is a heritage awarded brand and one of the iconic representation of Singapore. It is a must-try delicacy for anyone visiting the country.



 



As a market leader in the barbecued meat industry, we consistently ensure high quality standards in nutrition and hygiene. We also continually invest in product research and technology innovation in order to gain and maintain our competitive advantage. Our bakkwa boasts the highest quality of meat and it contains the best natural ingredients with no added MSG, preservatives and artificial flavoring.



 



As in all dynamic organisations, we believe that employees are the greatest asset. We are always committed to enhance the growth of our employees' performance and their ability to work effectively as part of a team through progressive training and development.



 



Bee Cheng Hiang now employs more than 3000 staff with over 360 retail outlets across Singapore, Malaysia, China, Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan, Korea, Japan, Indonesia, Cambodia, Vietnam, Philippines and Thailand.





Our Corporate Vision:

To be Asia’s leading food company providing quality products and services to the global market

 



Our Awards and Achievements:

• Singapore ISO9002 Certified since 1997

• Singapore HACCP Certified since 1999

• Singapore Promising Brand Award (2002 - 2005)

• Retail Courtesy Gold Award (2003)

• Singapore Most Popular Brand Award (2003, 2004)

• Excellence Service Awards (2003-2006, 2014)

• Singapore Food Safety Partners Status with AVA (Agri-food & Veterinary Authority) since 2005

• Singapore Prestige Brand Award - Regional Brand Winner (2009)

• Singapore Prestige Brand Award - Most Popular Brand Winner (2009)

Job Title: Finance Officer/Senior (Accounts/Fullsets, Client Accounting) - 1 Year Contract
Company:
Capita Pte Ltd - Business Support 1    							     
																						
(Recruitment Firm)
Job Description:
Job responsibilities:
• Responsible for keeping full set of accounts which includes, account payables, account receivables, general accounting and fixed assets processes
• Prepare and/or review monthly GL, balance sheet, profit or loss statement, audit schedules and follow up on outstanding items
• Manage accurate and timely closing of books for the month and prepare financial reports
• Support the clients in all relevant Financial Reporting requirements, analysis, reports and deliverables.
• Manage/ Support audit within stipulated timelines
• Manage/ Support ad-hoc Finance/Accounting related projects/ initiatives, as and when required.   
 
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor’s Degree / Diploma in Accountancy, Finance, and/or ACCA or other professional accounting qualifications (eg. Chartered Accountant)
• At least 1 year of working experience in Finance/Accounting Operations, preferably in shared services environment
• Good unstanding of Finance/ Accounting concepts
• Proficiency in PC skills, Microsoft Office
• Good written and verbal communication skills
• Good analysis, organizational and planning, problem solving skills, proactive and self-motivated with ability to multi-task
• Team player and enjoy working with variety of clients
• Independent, confident and customer-oriented disposition
• Meticulous and organized with high level of accuracy
• Able to handle high volume of transactions
• Entry-level candidates are welcomed to apply
 
 
Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please email us an updated copy of your resume (Attn:CAL) in Ms word format. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Email Address : bs1@capitasingapore.com

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).
 
More information about Capita Pte Ltd is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp.

Job Title: Accountant / Senior Finance Executive (Accounts Payable) (6-Month Contract)
Job Description:
Job Responsibilities
 
You will be responsible for the monthly AP closing and reporting for various accounting entities within the business unit, including the review of invoices, journal vouchers, schedules, batch payments, staff claims and close adherence to company’s policies and guidelines. You will need to ensure compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements including statistical reports to government agencies. You will need to prepare variance analysis and be involved in annual budgeting and forecasting. You will also need to liaise with auditors and tax agents for year-end audits and tax filing/compliance. You will also be involved in ad-hoc operational projects, including conducting credit review for selection of vendors, testing of SAP system etc, from time to time.
 
Job Requirements
 
You should be a qualified Accountant who possesses a Degree in Accountancy or ACCA or its equivalent with at least 4 years’ relevant hands-on accounting experience. To succeed in this role, you should possess good knowledge in SFRS and well-versed in Excel. Ability to work meticulously in a fast-paced environment is critical. You should also be a good team player, driven, independent, possess initiative and have the ability to deliver quality work within a stipulated timeline. You should also possess a good working attitude, good analytical skills and a strong sense of responsibility. Candidates with prior SAP and real estate knowledge will have an added advantage.
 
Interested applicants, please submit your resume online via 
APPLY Now
.
 
(We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Mapletree Investments Pte Ltd shall not be responsible or liable to any recruitment firm or agency in connection with the receipt of any unsolicited information on any prospective candidate.)
company_desc:
Mapletree is a leading real estate development, investment and capital management company headquartered in Singapore.

		

			

				 

			

				Mapletree Investments Pte Ltd (Mapletree) is focused on delivering value to its stakeholders through its business model that maximises capital efficiency. In executing a business strategy that combines the roles of real estate development, investment and capital management, Mapletree has generated consistently good returns to its stakeholders, and established a track record for building award-winning development projects across various real estate classes.

			

				 

			

				As at 31 March 2018, Mapletree owns and manages S$46.3 billion of office, retail, logistics, industrial, residential, corporate housing / serviced apartment, and student accommodation properties. Presently, Mapletree manages four Singapore-listed real estate investment trusts (REITs) and six private real estate funds, which hold a diverse portfolio of assets in Asia Pacific, the United Kingdom (UK) and the United States (US). The Group has also established an extensive network of offices in Singapore, Australia, China, Hong Kong SAR, India, Japan, Malaysia, South Korea, the UK, the US and Vietnam.

			

				 

			

				Mapletree’s portfolio includes award-winning properties in Singapore such as VivoCity, Mapletree Business City and STT Tai Seng 1, as well as mixed-use developments in the region such as Mapletree Business City Shanghai and VivoCity Shanghai, and Nanhai Business City in China.

			

				 

			

				Visit our website at http://www.mapletree.com.sg/ to find out more.

Job Title: Accounts Officer (reporting and analysis)/ Changi / Urgent! *R
Company:
Capita Pte Ltd – Temp & Contract    							     
																						
(Recruitment Firm)
Job Description:
ACCOUNTS OFFICER                
Location : Changi North way
Working hours: Mon – Fri 8.30am – 5.30pm
Salary up $4000
6 months contract 
                        
The Job:
•
 Management reporting and analysis
o Support in the accurate completion and timely submission of all monthly, quarterly, year end and adhoc reporting requirements for Corporate Office and internal stakeholders for 2-3 legal entities.
o Assist in preparation of internal management booklet, reports to facilitate decision making or performance tracking; and adhoc reporting needs.
• Budgeting and Planning
o Provide support in preparation and development of all budgeting or strategy planning needs 
o Prepare and consolidate budget schedules fulfilling both internal and Corporate requirements
o Assist with preparation of budget presentation slides
• 
Activity Based Costing and Profitability Analysis
o Assist in the preparation of monthly Activity Based Costing for Total Company
o Responsible for computation, completion and sharing of monthly Client Billings via Activity Based Costing (5-10 Clients)
• 
Business Partnering and Support
o Provide support to the various Segments stakeholders together with the Financial Analyst/ reporting Lead.
• 
Operational Accounting
o Provide support and management of selected Key Clients’ payables and billables portfolio
• Lead or proactive participation in project initiatives or process improvements such as Finance Transformatiion ..etc.
• Assist in any other ad hoc duties or projects as assigned by the Company.
 
Requirements:
• Degree in Accountancy / Finance / Business Administration(Accountancy) and/ or equivalent Professional Accounting 
• Minimum 2 to 4 years of relevant experience in similar capacity
• Strong technical competencies in both profit & loss and balance sheet items, and financial analysis
• Good working knowledge in SAP COPA and BPC
• Excellent IT skills in Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and Word
• Knowledge of Tableau would be an advantage
 
Job Code: RINC
Email Address: tc05@capitagrp.com
As this position is urgent, kindly email detailed CV attention to RINC with current and expected salary, notice period and reason for leaving each job. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).
 
More information about Capita Pte Ltd is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp.

Job Description:
We are hiring a Finance Accounts Executive to join our fast growing and vibrant team.  This position is a newly created position and will be reporting to Group Accountant for V3 Group.



 



The successful candidate will have strong attention to details and has the ability to multi-task.



 



Job Description




	

	
Handle full sets of accounts for company level

	

	

	
Preparing monthly financial and management reports

	

	

	
Checking and preparation of payment vouchers, petty cash, staff expenses and claims

	

	

	
Preparation of balance sheet schedules and bank reconciliation

	

	

	
Prepare and submit goods and services tax (GST) return

	

	

	
Other ad-hoc accounting related duties

	





Requirements




	

	
Minimum Diploma in Accountancy or with relevant qualification

	

	

	
At least 2 years of relevant working experience

	

	

	
Team player with strong attention to details

	

	

	
Ability to multi-task

	

	

	
As some financial reports are in Chinese, the ability to read and write Chinese language would be an added advantage
company_desc: V3 Group is the holding company for a portfolio of luxury lifestyle & wellness brands - OSIM, TWG Tea, ONI Global, LAC & Futuristic. The Group is headquartered in Singapore and operates more than 600 stores worldwide, over 100 cities in 16 countries.

Job Description:
The JMP Division of SAS is successful and growing, which means we are in the market for smart people to join our sales team. At JMP, we offer very competitive income, work/life balance and career growth opportunities. We believe people is our most important asset. As a JMP Accounts Executive role you will be responsible for the sales of JMP product family to existing customers and new accounts in Southeast Asia.
Responsibilities will include:
• Sells software, solutions and services to current and prospective customers; works with other sales/pre-sales/domain/personnel to position and leverage sales opportunities to acquire, grow and retain customers within assigned territory.
• Fulfills wide range of requests for information from prospective customers. Qualifies level of opportunity and resources required.
• Prospects within a territory or account to uncover business needs.
• Implements aspects of territory and account management and development; identifies accounts with high "close" potential, qualifies, advances opportunity through milestone steps of sales cycle and forecast time frames to close business within Orion.
• Works closely with pre-sales resources and executives to facilitate timely response to highly qualified, high revenue potential opportunities.
• Prepares standard quotations and proposal information as needed; works with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for delivery services.
• Follows up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.
• Develops a basic understanding of company pricing, licensing procedures and approvals matrix.
• Fully utilizes account planning process and tools (Account Plans and Opportunity Plans within BASE).
• Performs other duties, as assigned.
 
Requirements
Essential
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering/ statistic or related background
• 3+ years of successful experience in sales of computer software, hardware or IT solutions (such as ERP, CRM, Data warehouse and etc)
• Good communication through phone and email
• Willing to learn and to grow to next level of career
 
Additional
• Knowledge of software acquisition cycles
• Written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills and organizational skills
• Ability to work independently as well as part of a team comprised of a Pre-sales consultant, Account Manager
• Ability to sell training and service
• Ability to quickly build trust and maintain long term relationship with existing accounts
• Ability to build trust through phone call, email and other on-line channels
company_desc:
SAS is the leader in analytics. Through innovative analytics solutions, business intelligence and data management software and services, SAS helps customers at more than 75,000 sites improve performance and deliver value by making better decisions faster. Since 1976, SAS has been giving customers around the world THE POWER TO KNOW®.
 
To view current vacancies at SAS, please visit us at: http://www.sas.com/en_us/careers.html

Job Description:
Handle full set of bookkeeping and accounts including reporting

	
Preparation of accounts for annual audit and then liaise with auditors

	
Manage Intercompany transactions and confirmations

	
Manage monthly closing of books

	
Preparation of monthly accounting schedules

	
Preparation of monthly / quarterly reports

	
Preparation of GST Submissions

	
Assist in ad hoc projects when required

	
Preparation of tax computation

	
Preparation of Tax Returns for submission





 



Job Requirements




	
Minimum Diploma in accounting qualification, with 1 year related working experience

	
Meticulous, pro-active, independent with strong analytical and communication nskills

	
Good interpersonal skills and the ability to multitask in a fast paced environment

	
Ability to handle deadlines with commitment and willing to learn

	
Proficient in Microsoft Office Skills and MYOB knowledge

	
Familiar with handling multi currencies
company_desc: We are providing audit, accounting, tax and secretarial services. We offer one-stop professionalism, convenience, and peace of mind to local and foreign  entrepreneurs to set up and conduct business in Singapore and the region.

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities
 
Perform intercompany vendor/customer balances from SAP and prepare Reconciliation Report
Analyse and reconcile accounts, and prepare GL Account Analysis and Reconciliation Reports including foreign currency accounting
Perform Month-end, quarter-end and year-end closing
Monthly expense variance analysis
Assist in preparation of GST submissions to IRAS and corporate tax schedule
Ensure accuracy of financial statements and compliance to internal policies
Any other duties and responsibilities as may be reasonably requested by your immediate supervisor / the head of department from time to time
Job Requirements
 
Diploma from Accountancy / ACCA Level 2
At least 2 years of experience in General Ledger (full set of accounts)
Preferably have experience in SAP system
company_desc:
Keppel Land
 is the property arm of the Keppel Group, one of Singapore's largest multinational groups with key businesses in offshore and marine, infrastructure as well as property.

	

		 

	

		One of Asia's premier property companies, Keppel Land is recognised for its sterling portfolio of award-winning residential developments and investment-grade commercial properties as well as high standards of corporate governance and transparency. The Company is geographically diversified in Asia, with Singapore and China as its core markets as well as Vietnam and Indonesia as its growth markets. It has two listed companies, one each in the Philippines and Thailand. Keppel Land focuses on a two-pronged strategy of property development for sale and property fund management.

Job Title: Accounts Officer (reporting and analysis)/ Changi / Urgent! *R
Company:
Capita Pte Ltd – Temp & Contract    							     
																						
(Recruitment Firm)
Job Description:
ACCOUNTS OFFICER                
Location : Changi North way
Working hours: Mon – Fri 8.30am – 5.30pm
Salary up $4000
6 months contract 
                        
The Job:
•
 Management reporting and analysis
o Support in the accurate completion and timely submission of all monthly, quarterly, year end and adhoc reporting requirements for Corporate Office and internal stakeholders for 2-3 legal entities.
o Assist in preparation of internal management booklet, reports to facilitate decision making or performance tracking; and adhoc reporting needs.
• Budgeting and Planning
o Provide support in preparation and development of all budgeting or strategy planning needs 
o Prepare and consolidate budget schedules fulfilling both internal and Corporate requirements
o Assist with preparation of budget presentation slides
• 
Activity Based Costing and Profitability Analysis
o Assist in the preparation of monthly Activity Based Costing for Total Company
o Responsible for computation, completion and sharing of monthly Client Billings via Activity Based Costing (5-10 Clients)
• 
Business Partnering and Support
o Provide support to the various Segments stakeholders together with the Financial Analyst/ reporting Lead.
• 
Operational Accounting
o Provide support and management of selected Key Clients’ payables and billables portfolio
• Lead or proactive participation in project initiatives or process improvements such as Finance Transformatiion ..etc.
• Assist in any other ad hoc duties or projects as assigned by the Company.
 
Requirements:
• Degree in Accountancy / Finance / Business Administration(Accountancy) and/ or equivalent Professional Accounting 
• Minimum 2 to 4 years of relevant experience in similar capacity
• Strong technical competencies in both profit & loss and balance sheet items, and financial analysis
• Good working knowledge in SAP COPA and BPC
• Excellent IT skills in Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and Word
• Knowledge of Tableau would be an advantage

Strategic follow up of key customers collections within the chinese market
Effective monitoring of key customers and activities
Own and resolve incoming customer inquiries regarding invoicing, contract management, license provisioning, as well as account cancellations and reductions
Resolve escalated internal and external customer situations

Degree in Accounting or Business
4 years experience in collections / accounts receivables
Good customer relationship skills to manage a variety of customer interactions
Proficiency in Mandarin is a must as this role handles the chinese market 
Able to excel in a fast paced environment delivering accuracy while managing deadlines
Interested applicants, kindly write in your 
updated CV in WORD format 
to margaret_ng@kellyservices.com.sg
company_desc:
About Kelly Services®
As a global leader in providing workforce solutions, Kelly Services, Inc. (Nasdaq: KELYA, KELYB) and its subsidiaries, offer a comprehensive array of outsourcing and consulting services as well as world-class staffing on a temporary, temporary-to-hire, and direct-hire basis.  Kelly® directly employs nearly 500,000 people around the world in addition to having a role in connecting thousands more with work through its global network of talent suppliers and partners. 
 
For more than 35 years, Kelly in Singapore has been partnering the finest local companies, key government agencies as well as some of the world’s most respected multinational companies to deliver the best talent in the market. Kelly centralised recruitment hub makes nearly 8,000 placements in Singapore annually.
Complementing our general staffing capability, Kelly also offers great expertise in the sourcing of specialised professionals across technical disciplines such as Engineering, Technology and Science, as well as functional specialties for Banking & Finance, HR, Sales & Marketing, and Procurement. Visit www.kellyservices.com.sg and connect with us on Facebook & LinkedIn.

company_desc:
Shingda is a local civil engineering firm incorporated in 1986. Being a specialist contractor in pipeline works, Shingda obtained most of its projects through open tender for Government Project. Our customer includes Public Utilities Board of Singapore and Changi Airport Group.

	 

	Shingda is accorded the Singapore Quality Class – Star, and Singapore Innovation Class and is certified to ISO 9000, ISO 14000, OSHAS 18000 and Biz Safe – Star. With staff strength of close to 400 and a construction fleet of more than a hundred, professionalism, quality and efficiency are our key business attributes in propelling our business towards sustained excellence.

company_desc:
At the Forefront of Education Innovation



Hwa Chong Institution (HCI) is Singapore's premier independent school, with a rich history of over 90 years. HCI was the first mega-school in Singapore to offer six-year 'through-train' Integrated Programme (IP).



The Institution offers a host of MOE and school-based Talent Development Programmes. They include the Science and Math Talent Programme; Humanities Programme; Bicultural Studies Programme; Language Elective (Chinese) Programme; Art Elective Programme; as well as Research and Enrichment Programmes with both local and overseas institutions of learning.



In 2009, HCI was featured as one of the world's most innovative schools by the South China Morning Post, Hong Kong's premier English daily. Some exciting initiatives in the school include the FutureSchool@HCI and opportunities to teach at the Hwa Chong-Beijing Satellite Campus. Indeed, there is never a dull moment in Hwa Chong.

Job Description:
Job Purpose
 
This role supports the Finance Shared Services - Accounts Receivable team in the following:
Oversee operation matters of Payment Enquiry team who are handling enquiries via incoming calls and emails from patients / corporate customer and ensure timely closure.  Improve patients’ experience and satisfaction and garner Compliments from patients.
Communicate withhospital staff (Business Office, Service Quality, Wards and Clinics) to manage complex complaints or feedback.
Services Improvements - work with respective team supervisors on staffs training, learning and development and also looking at ways to improve quality of work life balance for staff.  Work with external vendors on software Projects to re-design work process.
Main Roles and responsibilities
Supervise Payment Enquiry staffs attending to incoming calls and emails and ensure timely closure.
Attend Review meetings with respective Business Office heads for Self- Paying and Corporate customers for Accounts Receivable related matters
Manage complex complaints & feedback and work with colleague from hospitals for satisfactory closure.
Supervisory duties, engagement of staff and achieving section goals and objective.
Requirements
Minimum Bachelor Degree in any discipline
5 year experience in AR Management and in a managerial position. Experience in Customer Service and Call Centre is preferred but not essential.
Strong data analysis skill.
Preferably IT-savvy
Excellent spoken and written communication skill
company_desc:
NHG’s vision is “Adding years of healthy life”. This vision departs from merely healing the sick to the more challenging and infinitely more rewarding task of preventing illness and preserving health and quality of life.
	

		 

	

		NHG is a leader in public healthcare in Singapore, recognised at home and abroad for the quality of its medical expertise and facilities.

	

		 

	

		

			Care is provided through an integrated network of nine primary healthcare polyclinics, acute care and tertiary hospitals, national specialty centres and business divisions. Together, they bring a rich legacy of more than 340 years of medical expertise to our philosophy of patient-centric care.

		

			 

		

			By designing accessible and seamless healthcare services around patients' needs, NHG ensures that patient care is fully coordinated within the cluster and is also extended to a high level of collaboration with other healthcare providers at home and abroad.

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
 
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
Capita has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).
More information about Capita Staffing & Search is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp.

Job Description:
We are hiring an Accounts Executive to join our dynamic team at our headquarters in Singapore.
 
Responsibilities of this position:
1. Daily Banking:
-Preparation of payments and posting of same to the Finance system.
-Perform System Reconciliations for different entities in the Group for HQ.
-Ensure the ledger is kept up to date and Sundry Creditors schedules are in order for month end closing.
-Perform Bank Reconciliations on a periodic basis and liaise with the Banks in case of any requirements.
 
2. Maintenance of Ledgers & Schedules:
-Keep up to date the Accounts and Audit Schedules (Prepaid, Accruals, Monthly Expenditure Schedule)
-Liaise with Internal & External Auditors.
-Posting of regular Month End Close Journal Entries.
-Posting Intercompany Transactions in the system
 
3. Other duties:
-Preparation of GST Submission of Singapore GST Registered Entities in the Group
-Active participation in the Automation drive and IT projects related to Corporate Finance Scope
-Ad hoc duties as assigned by the Supervisor
 
The candidate will report to the Finance Manager.
 
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
company_desc:
Established in 1948, Tolaram Group has a diversified portfolio consisting of manufacturing, energy, real estate, digital services and infrastructure businesses. With over 60 years of successful entrepreneurship, Tolaram Group has evolved from being traders to manufacturers to brand builders, establishing our leadership in several industries across different geographies. Headquartered in Singapore, with offices in Asia, Africa and Europe, Tolaram Group hires over 9,000 employees globally and exports products to over 75 countries. The Group is also actively involved in several not-for-profit initiatives.

	

		 

	

		In Tolaram, we believe our people are our greatest assets. Our team is made up of varied nationalities, making it a melting pot of unique cultures. We believe in individuality and developing our people based on their strengths to help them reach their maximum potential, whilst working closely and harmoniously as a team.

	

		 

	

		We nurture, mentor and guide our human capital enabling them to deliver the best results collectively. We believe in a management style that facilitates empowerment of people in positions of responsibilities.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
company_desc:
Established in 1948, Tolaram Group has a diversified portfolio consisting of manufacturing, energy, real estate, digital services and infrastructure businesses. With over 60 years of successful entrepreneurship, Tolaram Group has evolved from being traders to manufacturers to brand builders, establishing our leadership in several industries across different geographies. Headquartered in Singapore, with offices in Asia, Africa and Europe, Tolaram Group hires over 9,000 employees globally and exports products to over 75 countries. The Group is also actively involved in several not-for-profit initiatives.

	

		 

	

		In Tolaram, we believe our people are our greatest assets. Our team is made up of varied nationalities, making it a melting pot of unique cultures. We believe in individuality and developing our people based on their strengths to help them reach their maximum potential, whilst working closely and harmoniously as a team.

	

		 

	

		We nurture, mentor and guide our human capital enabling them to deliver the best results collectively. We believe in a management style that facilitates empowerment of people in positions of responsibilities.

company_desc:
Dar el Bacha, the finest luxury coffee brand in the world, is rooted in Marrakech, Morocco. Built in 1907, the spectacular Dar el Bacha palace, which means “the house of the pasha”, reunited the greatest cultural and political minds of the century over glittering pots of “coffee of Arabia” – known today as Arabica.



 



Awash with the colours, light and textures of Morocco, Dar El Basha is the expression of the art of refined living, with patios planted with towering palms, ceilings decorated with carved cedar wood, porticos stained with saffron, walls ornamented with zelliges and floors carpeted with marble inlay. The Dar el Bacha coffee house showcases the largest list of coffees from every coffee producing country in the world, in addition to the delights of the table, reflected in timeless accessories and signature sweets and savoury foodstuffs that pair perfectly with our coffees.



 



Today, Dar el Bacha has today evolved into a luxury concept incorporating unique and original retail locations, exquisite coffee houses and an international distribution network to professionals. Committed to offering the finest single origin coffees, Dar el Bacha’s collection is the largest in the world, with exquisitely roasted beans from every coffee producing country as well as exclusive blends.

Job Description:
**This is NOT a finance role.
 
Based Singapore, the successful candidate will be responsible to oversee the management of key Global Account customers in the Asia Region to drive revenue and profitability growth. This position reports to the Senior Global Accounts Manager for SEA.
 
Responsibilities:
As a Global Accounts Manager, you will manage and execute commercial activities for in Asia Region.
You are responsible for developing, leading, and managing key account negotiations, as well as ensuring the company meets revenue quotas on a global scale.
Manage and monitor the commercial performances of assigned accounts.
Set up the commercial and pricing policy in agreement with the lines, business development plan and strategies in compliance with the Group policy.
Prepare visit reports / market studies and perform other tasks as required by Management.
Communicate the commercial directions to the network and ensure correct application
Focus on customer relationship development, establishment and improvement
Be active and dare to take initiative to find new customers
Coordinate with operations and Cargo Flow Teams as well as other internal department to ensure the best operational service to customers
Requirements:                
              
Minimum 5 years of working experience in shipping / transport industry with strong commercial experience / operational experience in Singapore and the region
Possessesstrong leadership, negotiation and communication skills with a strong sense of customer oriented.
Good team player
Strong communication skills
Strong in computer application
company_desc:
From its base in Marseille, the CMA CGM Group is present in more than 160 countries through its network of over 600 agencies, with more than 29,000 employees worldwide (4,500 in France).

	

	With a young and diversified fleet of 536 vessels, the CMA CGM Group serves over 420 of the world's 521 commercial ports. Through more than 200 shipping lines, the company operates on every one of the world's seas. Its global presence and efficient ships like the CMA CGM BOUGAINVILLE enabled the CMA CGM Group to transport a volume of 18 million TEUs last year.

	

	The CMA CGM Group revenues total US$ 21 billion in 2015 (Combined proforma CMA CGM NOL 2015), proving that "family business" companies are efficient and make it possible for French industry to rise to the upper echelons of world trade.

	

	There are 2,400 staff members working at the Group's head office, the CMA CGM Tower in Marseille. It is a building worthy of a major player in the French economy. The Group has 6,300 French customers and CMA CGM is the largest private employer in Marseille, the city where the company was founded in 1978.

Assisting the Head of Finance - Operations, this role involves administrative tasks such as filing, scanning, coordinating.

	
Day to day processing of vendor invoices and employee claims. Ensuring all payments prepared by COE team are processed and released 

	
Review and screening, requesting for approval, scanning, proper channeling of the invoices to the COE Team and monitor status

And any other ad-hoc assignments as assigned

Job Requirements:




	
Diploma in Accountancy (ACCA, and other accounting certifications will be considered)

	
Minimum 2-3 years of relevant experience

	
Proactive, works fast and communicates well in oral and written English

	
Proficient with of MS Office - Excel, and familiarity with Google Suites, software: MYOB, SAP is a plus

Job Description:
Job Description





 



Position                     :                      Accounts Assistant



Location                    :                      Singapore           



Reporting To             :                      Accountant



Department               :                      Finance



Direct Reports           :                      None



_______________________________________________________





Purpose:



This position will be serving with 12-months contract term which to support an Accountant in finance activities in the areas of accounting, tax and financial planning.



 



The Accounts Assistant will be be responsible for all accounting and clerical tasks for the maintenance and processing of accounts receivable and tax.



 



Responsibilities:



1.    Accounting




	
To ensure that all receivable is processed accurately on a timely manner and in accordance to the internal control within the Company:
	

		
Setting up new client database in accounting system

		
Coding of client’s invoices and input into accounting system

		
Prepare inter-company billings

		
Review AR ageing reports follow up with clients on outstanding debts

		
Prepare AR reconciliation to Gross Billings

		
Verify and calculate all extensions and totals on invoices (calculating and taking discounts when applicable)

		
Prepare the monthly statement of accounts to clients

		
Prepare intercompany AR revaluation

		
Explore the use of online banking for electronic payments

		
Correspond with clients and respond to inquiries

		
Prepare month end Balance Sheet Schedules

	

	

	
To ensure that general and subsidiary ledgers are kept for prompt monthly closing within T+5:
	

		
Prepare and enter general ledger journals for receipts

		
Reconciliation of bank accounts, sub-ledger to control account and inter-company accounts

		
Prepare and enter general ledger journals for GST and VAT

	

	

	
Support external audit requirements, including preparation of audit schedules and ensuring timely resolution of audit findings

	
Ensure accounting records and systems are in compliance with Group policies, approved accounting standards and statutory requirements

	
Develop and maintain a filing system






	
Ensure accounting records are filed in chronological order on a daily basis





2.    Taxation




	
Ensure compliance of corporate income tax matters in terms of timely submission through preparation of tax schedules and internal income tax computation.

	
Handle VAT preparation to be ready for review by supervisor.

	
Drive the claim of foreign VAT through VAT consultants.

	
Handle GST quarterly preparation to be ready for review by supervisor.





3.    Financial Planning




	
To support Financial Planning and Analysis (FPNA) Analyst for the upgrade of financial systems and tools to automate budgeting and reporting functions which will enable management to quickly and accurately assess financial performance and trends

	
To assist in the quarterly forecasting and annual budgeting.





4.    Systems




	
Maintenance of mapping tables in SAGE CRM

	
Maintenance of contract maintenance in SAGE ACCPAC

	
Assist in testing and development of new systems







5.    Governmental Survey:




	
Ensure consistency in statistic reports







6.    Any other duties that will be designated by the superiors to meet exigencies of work.



 



Education:




	
Minimum Higher NITEC / LCCI Level 3





Experience:




	
Candidates with accounting/admin work experience will be an added advantage

	
Candidates with no prior experience with a willing to learn attitude are welcomed to apply





Skills/Knowledge:




	
Financially astute with good analytical skills and detailed oriented

	
Strong inter-personal, communication and presentation skills, and be comfortable interacting with executive-level management

	
Ability to multi-task and work under pressure in a challenging fast paced environment whilst meeting tight deadlines.

	
Proficient in MS Office

	
Preferably able to start work immediately or on short notice





Salary: 
SGD 1,500 to SGD 2,000
company_desc:
A leader in Alzheimer’s disease research, TauRx’s mission is to discover, develop and commercialise innovative products for the diagnosis, treatment and cure of neurodegenerative diseases caused through protein aggregation.



 



From initial discovery through preclinical development to clinical trials, regulatory submission and product registration, we are harnessing world-class proprietary drug discovery platforms with the aim of halting the progression of Alzheimer’s and other neurodegenerative diseases with innovative treatments and diagnostics.



 



The company’s novel tau aggregation inhibitors (TAIs) target the formation (aggregation) of tau protein ‘tangles’ in the brain. The spread of tau tangles – the main driver in Alzheimer’s disease – is strongly correlated with dementia and they can develop in the brain up to 20 years before symptoms associated with dementia develop. TAIs work by dissolving existing tau aggregates and preventing the further aggregation of tau protein from forming new tangles.



 



Our lead compound, LMTX®, inhibits aggregation of tau, synuclein, TPD-43 and huntingtin proteins. Patented as a novel chemical entity and chemically distinct from TauRx’s initial research compound, rember®, LMTX® has shown promise for slowing disease progression in Alzheimer’s disease and behavioural variant frontotemporal dementia.



 



Three LMTX® Phase 3 clinical trials, conducted in over 20 countries and involving over 1,900 patients, have recently completed. For a summary of the programme and study results, please follow this link. 



 



Following these Phase 3 trials, TauRx has started a new clinical trial, named LUCIDITY. For further information, and to understand the eligibility criteria for the LUCIDITY trial, or to find a site close to you, please use the following link: https://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT03446001?term=TRX0237&rank=5
