Job Description:
Work Location: Central area

	
Working Days: 5 days (Mon-Fri)

	
Working Hours: 10:00am to 6:30pm

	
Salary Range: $2000 - $3000 (Depending on experience and qualifications)





Roles & Responsibilities




	
Verify and process all suppliers’ invoices

	
Data entry in accounting systems (Quickbooks)

	
Verify accounting entries before posting to ensure expenses are recorded in the correct financial period

	
Review and verify Corporate card expenses

	
Ensure timely payment to suppliers and follow up on outstanding matters relating to invoices / payments

	
Bank Reconciliations

	
General ledger and prepare journal entries whenever needed.

	
Maintain Staff database and generate monthly payroll

	
Any other adhoc duties assigned by superiors





Requirements




	
LCCI/CAT/ACCA, Diploma in Accountancy or equivalent with a min. of 1~2 years of accounting experience.

	
Experience with processing of Internet banking transactions.

	
Technical Knowledge on Singapore Financial Reporting Standards, taxation(such as GST, Company Income Tax and withholding Tax)

	
Knowledge and experience in MS Office, MS Excel and accounting software such as QuickBooks.

	
Meticulous with an eye for details.

	
A good team player and able to handle urgent/ad-hoc request effectively

	
Able to start work immediately will be highly preferred
company_desc:
SETTING IT GROUP PTE LTD (Chinese name: Siyi Technology) is a HK Internet technology company, providing one-stop consulting services and solutions for technology, branding and marketing. In September 2018, we ushered in a sub-brand company, SETTING IT UNICORN, to expand our business map to the garden city – Singapore, in Southeast Asia, hoping to provide a full range of technology development, brand packaging, marketing solutions for more high-quality projects. “Think more wishful things, less to unpleasant things” represents our optimistic attitude towards career and cooperation. Setting IT is dedicated to becoming the industry unicorn and providing the most professional and comprehensive services for companies and projects.



 



SETTING IT GROUP PTE LTD（中文名：思一科技）是一间香港的互联网科技公司，我们提供从技术，品牌到市场的一站式咨询及服务。2018年9月，我们迎来了子品牌公司，SETTING IT UNICORN，将事业版图拓展到了东南亚地区的花园城市新加坡，希望能够为更多优秀的项目提供全方位的技术开发，品牌包装，市场营销解决方案。“不想八九，常思一二” 代表了我们无论对事业还是合作常持积极乐观的态度；“一门心思，做行业独角兽”更代表了我们对技术，品牌，市场服务的专，励志于为企业以及项目提供最专业和全面的咨询及服务。

Job Description:
Codigo is a technology company with a strong focus on UI/UX and proper coding methodology. Join us and work with brands and startups!



 



Check out what we do here! www.codigo.co



 



Job Description




	
Oversee all human resource, finance and office administration matters to ensure processes are smooth, compliant and effective.

	
Manage human resources from onboarding to offboarding and staff welfare.

	
Manage the company’s finances including payroll, quotations, invoices, statement of accounts.

	
Oversee and regulate AR collections, maintaining low DSO (days sales outstanding)

	
Oversee cash management ensuring adequacy of working capital and cash balances

	
Control overall spend. Work closely with other departments to provide guidance on excessive or unreasonable spending

	
Manage relationships with client finance teams and professional service vendors such as Banks and Auditors

	
Liaise with the Corporate Accountant, Government Authorities, Suppliers, Customers and other Partners to ensure timely, compliant and documented relationships 

	
Lead the annual audit process, prepare quarterly GST submission and handle local tax matters (IRAS), ensuring timely submission to local authorities

	
Be the first point of contact as the subject matter expert for all Finance and HR-related queries

	
Review and shape Codigo’s company culture, including all HR policies, company activities, and people development

	
Implement and master new technology software to help with company processes, including tools for communication, collaboration and reporting

	
Explore and implement opportunities for events, initiatives and programmes that are beneficial for the company

	
Ensure pantry is well stocked and all necessary sundries, office supplies are well stocked

Job Description:
Codigo is a technology company with a strong focus on UI/UX and proper coding methodology. Join us and work with brands and startups!



 



Check out what we do here! www.codigo.co



 



Job Description




	
Oversee all human resource, finance and office administration matters to ensure processes are smooth, compliant and effective.

	
Manage human resources from onboarding to offboarding and staff welfare.

	
Manage the company’s finances including payroll, quotations, invoices, statement of accounts.

	
Oversee and regulate AR collections, maintaining low DSO (days sales outstanding)

	
Oversee cash management ensuring adequacy of working capital and cash balances

	
Control overall spend. Work closely with other departments to provide guidance on excessive or unreasonable spending

	
Manage relationships with client finance teams and professional service vendors such as Banks and Auditors

	
Liaise with the Corporate Accountant, Government Authorities, Suppliers, Customers and other Partners to ensure timely, compliant and documented relationships 

	
Lead the annual audit process, prepare quarterly GST submission and handle local tax matters (IRAS), ensuring timely submission to local authorities

	
Be the first point of contact as the subject matter expert for all Finance and HR-related queries

	
Review and shape Codigo’s company culture, including all HR policies, company activities, and people development

	
Implement and master new technology software to help with company processes, including tools for communication, collaboration and reporting

	
Explore and implement opportunities for events, initiatives and programmes that are beneficial for the company

	
Ensure pantry is well stocked and all necessary sundries, office supplies are well stocked

	
Contribute to overall team success and happiness

Job Description:
R
esponsibilities
  
Assist in billing related activities such as tuition fee and miscellaneous fee charging to undergraduates (according to semester billing and ad hoc basis)
Perform collection of fees via Giro and Non-Giro methods
Process refunds to undergraduates with credit balances in student account
Monitoring of outstanding fees, maintain an instalment & deferment list and send reminders monthly
Assist in internal and external auditors' queries.
Prepare annual and monthly cash flow projections 
Prepare monthly account reconciliation between SAP and Student Billing System
Handle queries from students, parents, or other departments via email and/or phone.
Any ad hoc tasks assigned by Reporting Officer
 
 
 
 
Requirements
  
Minimum Diploma / Equivalent Qualification in Accounting
Minimum 2 years of relevant working experience
Service oriented and have initiative
Able to work with minimum supervision
Good in communication
Proficient in MS Excel and IT savvy
Can work independently and as a team
 
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
company_desc:
Young and research-intensive, Nanyang Technological University (NTU Singapore) is ranked 12th globally. It is also placed 1st among the world’s best young universities.

		

			 

		

			NTU offers engineering, science, business, humanities, arts and social sciences, and medicine. Its medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, is set up jointly with Imperial College London.NTU has more than 400 partnerships including joint PhD programmes with top academic institutions and joint laboratories with industry leaders such as BMW and Rolls-Royce.

		

		Known for its cutting-edge research and technological innovation, NTU is the No. 1 Asian university in terms of research citation impact (Clarivate Analytics’ InCites 2017).
		

			NTU is home to several world-class institutes and centres, including the Singapore Centre on Environmental Life Sciences Engineering and the Earth Observatory of Singapore.

		

		The lush NTU campus - the biggest in Singapore - is named is one of the top 15 most beautiful campuses. A cosmopolitan hub of more than 100 nationalities, the NTU community comprises about 33,000 students and 5,000 faculty and researchers.
		

			

			We invite you to be part of this world-class university.

		

		Connect with us at www.twitter.com/NTUsg, www.youtube.com/NTUsg.

Job Description:
Work Location: Central area

	
Working Days: 5 days (Mon-Fri)

	
Working Hours: 10:00am to 6:30pm

	
Salary Range: $2000 - $3000 (Depending on experience and qualifications)





Roles & Responsibilities




	
Verify and process all suppliers’ invoices

	
Data entry in accounting systems (Quickbooks)

	
Verify accounting entries before posting to ensure expenses are recorded in the correct financial period

	
Review and verify Corporate card expenses

	
Ensure timely payment to suppliers and follow up on outstanding matters relating to invoices / payments

	
Bank Reconciliations

	
General ledger and prepare journal entries whenever needed.

	
Maintain Staff database and generate monthly payroll

	
Any other adhoc duties assigned by superiors





Requirements




	
LCCI/CAT/ACCA, Diploma in Accountancy or equivalent with a min. of 1~2 years of accounting experience.

	
Experience with processing of Internet banking transactions.

	
Technical Knowledge on Singapore Financial Reporting Standards, taxation(such as GST, Company Income Tax and withholding Tax)

	
Knowledge and experience in MS Office, MS Excel and accounting software such as QuickBooks.

	
Meticulous with an eye for details.

	
A good team player and able to handle urgent/ad-hoc request effectively

	
Able to start work immediately will be highly preferred
company_desc:
SETTING IT GROUP PTE LTD (Chinese name: Siyi Technology) is a HK Internet technology company, providing one-stop consulting services and solutions for technology, branding and marketing. In September 2018, we ushered in a sub-brand company, SETTING IT UNICORN, to expand our business map to the garden city – Singapore, in Southeast Asia, hoping to provide a full range of technology development, brand packaging, marketing solutions for more high-quality projects. “Think more wishful things, less to unpleasant things” represents our optimistic attitude towards career and cooperation. Setting IT is dedicated to becoming the industry unicorn and providing the most professional and comprehensive services for companies and projects.



 



SETTING IT GROUP PTE LTD（中文名：思一科技）是一间香港的互联网科技公司，我们提供从技术，品牌到市场的一站式咨询及服务。2018年9月，我们迎来了子品牌公司，SETTING IT UNICORN，将事业版图拓展到了东南亚地区的花园城市新加坡，希望能够为更多优秀的项目提供全方位的技术开发，品牌包装，市场营销解决方案。“不想八九，常思一二” 代表了我们无论对事业还是合作常持积极乐观的态度；“一门心思，做行业独角兽”更代表了我们对技术，品牌，市场服务的专，励志于为企业以及项目提供最专业和全面的咨询及服务。

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).
 
More information about Capita Pte Ltd is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp.
 
<<<By submitting your curriculum vitae or personal data to us in connection with your job application, you are deemed to have read and agreed to the terms of our Privacy Policy, and consented to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data by us and our affiliates, in accordance with our Privacy Policy.
 
Please visit www.capitagrp.com for a copy of our Privacy Policy. If you wish to withdraw your consent, please drop us an email at "dataprotection@persolkelly.com" to let us know. (NOTE: any resumes or job applications sent to this data protection mailbox will NOT be attended to as it is solely for the purposes of personal data protection related feedback.)

Job Description:
√ Industry: Interior Design
√ Location: Central
√ Working Hours: Monday – Friday ( Office Hour )
√ Good Remuneration Package
Job Description:
Assisting the Head of Finance - Operations, this role involves administrative tasks such as filing, scanning, coordinating.
Day to day processing of vendor invoices and employee claims. Ensuring all payments prepared by COE team are processed and released
Review and screening, requesting for approval, scanning, proper channeling of the invoices to the COE Team and monitor status
Maintenance of all accounting files electronically and in hard copies (completed and in-progress)
Reconciliation of Vendor’s Statements and Employee Advances on a monthly basis
Manage vendor relationship by providing feedback on status of payments and providing copies of payment documents and replying to all vendor queries (phone and emails)
PO review and distribution to vendors, monitoring of acknowledgement and deposit payments.
Prepare and check reports including but not limited vendor aging, long outstanding accounts, weekly cash forecast and employee expense claim summary.
Assist on monthly accruals of invoices, bank, tax and audit related matters.
Job requirements:
Diploma in Accountancy (ACCA, and other accounting certifications will be considered)
Minimum 2-3 years of relevant experience
Proactive, works fast and communicates well in oral and written English
Proficient with of MS Office - Excel, and familiarity with Google Suites, software: MYOB, SAP is a plus
JOBID: 42385
All Successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits.
Kindly email your resume in a detailed Word format to 
jingyee.lim@peopleprofilers.com
 
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified
 
People Profilers Pte Ltd
EA Licence Number: 02C4944
Tel:  
6671 9881
EA Registration Number: R1872533
EA Personnel: Lim Jing Yee
company_desc:
Since our humble beginnings in 2002, People Profilers has steadily grown from strength to strength. Our expertise in providing Human Capital consultancy to our clients – universally sought after skills and expertise in just about any sector– has allowed People Profilers to leave an imprint across various industries and build a reputation for competency and expertise.
 
What differentiates People Profilers from every other recruiter is our unwavering commitment to building relationships with our clients- understanding exactly what our clients are after, and allowing us to match their precise needs. We deliver human capital solutions that allow organisations and their employees to succeed.
 
Here at People Profilers, we pride ourselves on being a one-stop human capital solutions provider for your organisation. Our innovative and relationship-focused workforce solutions have been provided across a wide range of industries.
 
Personal Data Protection Act
 
Please be informed that the personal data you provided by way of your job application to People Profilers will be collected, used and disclosed by or on behalf of People Profilers to determine or investigate your suitability, eligibility or qualifications for employment with People Profilers and/or its’ Clients and manage your application for employment with People Profilers and/or its’ clients, including identifying you as a potential candidate for future suitable positions and/or notifying you of any such positions, either existing or in the future.

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).

Job Description:

Salary Up to $7000
Location: Raffles Place
 
Job Descriptions:
●    Manage the monthly close process including the timely completion of close items and reporting in BFC
●    Monitor relevant guidance to ensure accounting policies and procedures are in compliance
●    Work closely with Finance IT team to improve system processes and reporting outputs
●    Project manage SOX and financial audit processes and maintain compliance with request deadlines
●    Maintain control documentation and lead development of additional automated/system controls
●    Perform month-end close activities, including preparation of journal entries and reconciliations for various balance sheet and income statement accounts

●    Prepare schedules and reports for management and external service providers
●    Provide a high level of customer service to finance and non-finance business partners
 
Requirements:
●    Bachelors degree in Accounting or related field
●    Chartered Accountant designation or equivalent
●    7+ years of proven progressive accounting experience, minimum of 2+ years managing deadline-driven close and reporting activities
●    2+ years experience in a similar role in a high-growth advertising agency or technology company
●    Experience managing a month-end close involving multiple financial systems (ie. MediaOcean and SAP)
●    Experience merging/integrating multiple financial systems and processes into a single reporting stream
●    Experience reporting financial information in BFC/Cartesis or similar consolidation systems
●    Experience with SAP BusinessOne, Blackline, BFC
●    Experience in a multi-country/currency environment
●    Advertising, Media, or Entertainment industry experience

company_desc:
Homage is a trusted senior home care marketplace and technology platform seamlessly connecting seniors to the best quality of care on demand.

 



The Homage platform uses a proprietary matching engine that pairs seniors with the best care professionals for their needs in real-time. Family members can schedule, manage, and monitor care visits through Homage family app from anywhere, stay in communication with the care professional and get real-time information on the care their senior is receiving. 



 



The model’s objective is threefold — to help seniors age with dignity, to unburden their family caregivers, and to turn compassionate people with caregiving experience into ‘micro-entrepreneurs’ — providing them with an opportunity to earn a 50% higher wage.

Provide any other ad-hoc financial and administrative support 







Requirements:




	
Diploma holders with 2-3 years of relevant experience in accounts receivables

	
Competent in Microsoft office applications especially Excel skills

	
Highly detailed and meticulous with good organisational skills

	
Good interpersonal, customer service

	
Able to work independently as well as in a team

	
Ability to embrace student-centric service culture

	
Able to handle information with integrity and confidentially
company_desc:
At the Forefront of Education Innovation



Hwa Chong Institution (HCI) is Singapore's premier independent school, with a rich history of over 90 years. HCI was the first mega-school in Singapore to offer six-year 'through-train' Integrated Programme (IP).



The Institution offers a host of MOE and school-based Talent Development Programmes. They include the Science and Math Talent Programme; Humanities Programme; Bicultural Studies Programme; Language Elective (Chinese) Programme; Art Elective Programme; as well as Research and Enrichment Programmes with both local and overseas institutions of learning.



In 2009, HCI was featured as one of the world's most innovative schools by the South China Morning Post, Hong Kong's premier English daily. Some exciting initiatives in the school include the FutureSchool@HCI and opportunities to teach at the Hwa Chong-Beijing Satellite Campus. Indeed, there is never a dull moment in Hwa Chong.

Job Description:
The JMP Division of SAS is successful and growing, which means we are in the market for smart people to join our sales team. At JMP, we offer very competitive income, work/life balance and career growth opportunities. We believe people is our most important asset. As a JMP Accounts Executive role you will be responsible for the sales of JMP product family to existing customers and new accounts in Southeast Asia.
Responsibilities will include:
• Sells software, solutions and services to current and prospective customers; works with other sales/pre-sales/domain/personnel to position and leverage sales opportunities to acquire, grow and retain customers within assigned territory.
• Fulfills wide range of requests for information from prospective customers. Qualifies level of opportunity and resources required.
• Prospects within a territory or account to uncover business needs.
• Implements aspects of territory and account management and development; identifies accounts with high "close" potential, qualifies, advances opportunity through milestone steps of sales cycle and forecast time frames to close business within Orion.
• Works closely with pre-sales resources and executives to facilitate timely response to highly qualified, high revenue potential opportunities.
• Prepares standard quotations and proposal information as needed; works with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for delivery services.
• Follows up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.
• Develops a basic understanding of company pricing, licensing procedures and approvals matrix.
• Fully utilizes account planning process and tools (Account Plans and Opportunity Plans within BASE).
• Performs other duties, as assigned.
 
Requirements
Essential
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering/ statistic or related background
• 3+ years of successful experience in sales of computer software, hardware or IT solutions (such as ERP, CRM, Data warehouse and etc)
• Good communication through phone and email
• Willing to learn and to grow to next level of career
 
Additional
• Knowledge of software acquisition cycles
• Written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills and organizational skills
• Ability to work independently as well as part of a team comprised of a Pre-sales consultant, Account Manager
• Ability to sell training and service
• Ability to quickly build trust and maintain long term relationship with existing accounts
• Ability to build trust through phone call, email and other on-line channels
company_desc:
SAS is the leader in analytics. Through innovative analytics solutions, business intelligence and data management software and services, SAS helps customers at more than 75,000 sites improve performance and deliver value by making better decisions faster. Since 1976, SAS has been giving customers around the world THE POWER TO KNOW®.
 
To view current vacancies at SAS, please visit us at: http://www.sas.com/en_us/careers.html

Job Description:

company_desc:
Keppel Land
 is the property arm of the Keppel Group, one of Singapore's largest multinational groups with key businesses in offshore and marine, infrastructure as well as property.

	

		 

	

		One of Asia's premier property companies, Keppel Land is recognised for its sterling portfolio of award-winning residential developments and investment-grade commercial properties as well as high standards of corporate governance and transparency. The Company is geographically diversified in Asia, with Singapore and China as its core markets as well as Vietnam and Indonesia as its growth markets. It has two listed companies, one each in the Philippines and Thailand. Keppel Land focuses on a two-pronged strategy of property development for sale and property fund management.

• Manage accurate and timely closing of books for the month and prepare financial reports

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).
 
More information about Capita Pte Ltd is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp.

company_desc: We are an established corporate services provider offering book-keeping, tax compliance, company secretarial and other back office services in Singapore with a diverse base of clients consisting of local and foreign enterprises across various industries.

General admin works.

	
Basic bookkeeping.

Basic knowledge of accounting principles.

Knowledge of MS Excel/Word/Powerpoint will be an advantage.

	
We can arrange working from home, or flexible working hours for right candidates after one year.
company_desc: We are an accounting and corporate services firm that works with entrepreneurs, small enterprises and businesses with operations in Singapore. We help business leaders focus on what they do by taking over their finance and corporate secretarial function. We ensure our clients get reliable and timely financial information which allows them to better govern their operations.

company_desc:
Star 360 Holdings Pte Ltd is the foremost active lifestyle and fashion brand purveyor in Asia Pacific. Founded in 2003 and headquartered in Singapore, Star 360 Holdings is a global lifestyle group with wholly owned subsidiaries in 16 markets with over 1,000 employees.  

	 

	We represent world class brands such as Cole Haan, Birkenstock, MBT, ASICS and SKECHERS. Star 360 owns and operates more than 100 specialty stores and distributes to more than 12,500 points-of-sale worldwide.

	 

	The group has now grown into an omni-channel powerhouse with all-encompassing core businesses in the wholesale, retail and e-commerce markets.  As such, we are seeking experienced, self-motivated and committed talents to join our team and walk on this epic journey with us.

To provide financial, clerical and administrative services to ensure efficient, timely and accurate payment of accounts under his or her control.

Generate age analysis and review AR aging to ensure compliance

Any ad-hoc tasks by the management





 



Education and Experience

Meticulous and responsible

	
Attention to detail and accuracy

	
Able to multi-task and work under tight timelines








	
Candidate must possess at least Professional Certificate/NiTEC, Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in Finance/Accountancy/Banking or equivalent.

company_desc:
Born as a single Singaporean bakery in 1997, Cedele has become a diverse destination for delicious, nutritious food with outlets across the globe. In our bakery-cafés, retail bakeries and all-day dining restaurants, we serve up classic comfort food with a creative twist, championing naturally healthy ingredients and time-honoured, artisan techniques.

Our principled approach means we say no to trans fats and artificial ingredients, and we carefully select each and every ingredient for its nutritional richness and exceptional flavour. All our recipes are taste-tested and made from scratch each day, so you can always enjoy creatively combined food that is positively delicious!
 
Today, we have Cedele outlets in Singapore and have spread our passion for creative, classic comfort food to Hong Kong too. But wherever we go, our philosophy remains the same: to create deliciously nutritious dishes from quality ingredients using authentic, traditional slow-cooking methods paired with uncompromising principles for food integrity.
 
Cedele’s 5 Core Principles
 
A home-grown business with a supportive atmosphere, Cedele is as passionate about people as it is about food. In return for your talent, hard work and commitment, we offer top-class training and personal development, and the opportunity to be part of the Cedele family.

Star 360 Holdings Pte Ltd is the foremost active lifestyle and fashion brand purveyor in Asia Pacific. Founded in 2003 and headquartered in Singapore, Star 360 Holdings is a global lifestyle group with wholly owned subsidiaries in 16 markets with over 1,000 employees.

company_desc:
About PIL

	Pacific International Lines (PIL) incorporated in 1967 has developed from a coastal shipowner/operator in Singapore to become one of the largest shipowners in Southeast Asia. Today, it is ranked 18th amongst the top containership operators in the world, offering container liner services and multi-purpose services at over 500 locations in 95 countries worldwide. PIL has diversified into logistics related activities such as supply chain management, consolidation/distribution facilities, warehousing, multi-modal services, container depot/terminal operations as well as having interest in ship-agencies worldwide, container manufacturing/repairs, ship recycling, marine services and real estate.

	 

	
PIL Operation

	PIL operates container liner services covering the whole of the Far East to Europe, Black Sea, Canada, the Indian sub-continent, Red Sea/Gulf, East Africa, South/West Africa, Australia, New Zealand, East Coast of South America and West Coast of USA. It has a dedicated network of feeder services covering a comprehensive range of ports in South East Asia, the Bay of Bengal and the East Coast of India. Effective March 2010, PIL also re-launched its Multi-purpose Service between China and Africa offering customers direct link for project and break bulk cargo between China and Africa ports.

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).

Book Keeping and month-end closing accounts

Prepare monthly schedule and GST workings for quarterly reporting

	
Any other adhoc assignments





Job Requirements:




	
Assign account codes to all transactions in the accounting system. 

	
Calculate customer/supplier account balances and reconcile with totals. 

	
Compile the relevant business documentation used in banking processes. 

	
 Enter accurate and timely data into the accounting system. 

	
 Maintain accurate financial records and statements. 

	
Perform month-end closing activities. 

	
Process payroll transactions into the organisations accounting system. 

	
Record and process all business transactions within the organisations accounting system using principles of double-entry accounting.

	
Record transactions and events relating to inventory, accruals, prepayments, capital structure and finance costs. 

	
Record transactions and events relating to sales, purchases, receivables, payables and cash. 

	
Retrieve system reports from the accounting system for managements use. 

	
Use relevant IT systems and tools effectively for data analysis.

We adopt a collaborative structure that encourages diverse and overlapping areas of expertise to achieve more comprehensive design solutions that transforms seemingly ordinary narratives and context into objects of meaningful beauty.

Star 360 Holdings Pte Ltd is the foremost active lifestyle and fashion brand purveyor in Asia Pacific. Founded in 2003 and headquartered in Singapore, Star 360 Holdings is a global lifestyle group with wholly owned subsidiaries in 16 markets with over 1,000 employees.  

	 

	We represent world class brands such as Cole Haan, Birkenstock, MBT, ASICS and SKECHERS. Star 360 owns and operates more than 100 specialty stores and distributes to more than 12,500 points-of-sale worldwide.

	 

	The group has now grown into an omni-channel powerhouse with all-encompassing core businesses in the wholesale, retail and e-commerce markets.  As such, we are seeking experienced, self-motivated and committed talents to join our team and walk on this epic journey with us.

Providing a full suite of property and asset management services for all asset types

			At Knight Frank Property Asset Management, we have a group of dynamic professionals with expertise in providing a full suite of management services such as lease and tenant management, advertising and promotion management, facility management, finance and human resource management, and property development consultancy services amongst others. We cover both strata-titled and single-owner properties across all asset types from shopping malls, industrial properties, offices to residential estates ranging from 50 to 1,000 units.

		

			 

		
Why Knight Frank

		Knight Frank Property Asset Management is one of the largest property and asset management companies in Singapore with a portfolio of 130 strata-titled developments (with over 28,000 units) and six million square feet of commercial space across 31 projects – retail, office, industrial and State. We are also ISO 9001 certified in Shopping Mall Management as well as in Property Management Services.

company_desc:
Transvert Scaffold & Engineering Pte Ltd was established in 1985 with the vision to be a scaffold specialist. Transvert provides quality metal scaffold services and its related engineering works to various sectors of construction industries in Singapore.Transvert has grown from strength to strength to become one of the leaders in scaffolding trade in Singapore, providing total access solutions for its clients. Transvert is committed to meeting every access requirement with safety at work sites in line with our Occupational Safety & Health Management System. At Transvert, we are just as committed to our employees. We select our associates for their talents, position them for success, and then provide them with opportunities to use their talents every day. Due to our rapid expansion in operations, we are seeking for committed, dynamic and innovative candidates to join us as:
 
Our Mission

1. To provide access solutions that genuinely contributes to site safety and work productivity.

2. To provide meaningful careers for our staff and workers whereby value is really addedto their lives and that of their families.

3. To make work safety a primary goal. Each worker and staff to be safe at the end of the day.

4. To be very profitable in the long run. Profit is critical to the healthy functioning of the company and to achieving the vision.

5. To provide an avenue where workers from developing countries get a real chance in life to have a future that is free from oppression.

Job Description:
Overall Job Objectives




	
To perform accounting functions, which include management and fixed asset reporting, journal entry preparation, balance reconciliation, and activities related to a period close.





Core Responsibilities




	

	
Responsible for day-to-day accounts receivable duties including cash management.

	

	

	
Process sundry suppliers’ invoices and payments including staff claims.

	

	

	
Daily updates of journal entries into accounting system.

	

	

	
Perform reconciliations and assist in monthly reporting.

	

	

	
Compile and analyze financial information to prepare financial statements, post journal and bank entries, calculate depreciation of fixed assets and perform monthly reconciliation.

	

	

	
Maintain and create new customers, suppliers and general ledger accounts in accounting system.

	

	

	
Verify accuracy of AP payment, claims and petty cash reimbursements and revenues.

	

	

	
Monitor and prepare to deposit cash and cheques received from outlets and customers into the bank.

	

	

	
Handle queries with suppliers and staff.

	

	

	
Assist in administrative duties and ad-hoc projects as and when assigned.

	





Job Requirements




	

	
Degree / Diploma / Certificate in Accountancy / Finance

	

	

	
At least 1 - 2 years of relevant working experience.

	

	

	
An analytical, hands-on team player with positive and mature thinking.

	

	

	
Meticulous, accurate, trustworthy and able to work independently.

	

	

	
Proficient in accounting system, Excel and MS Word.

	

	

	
Ability to multi-task and work under pressure.

	

	
Working hours: 5.5 day work week

	
Preferably able to start work immediately.

company_desc:
Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia.
 
Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs.
 
Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.
In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients.
 
Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015).
 
More information about Capita Pte Ltd is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp.

The long-term Vision of Acc Pro (Singapore) is to be the best 
Service-Oriented 
and

 in Singapore.



 



Acc Pro (Singapore) is set-up in 2015 with the mission:

2)      To develop a good learning environment and equip our 
Precious Human Capital Resources

Job Description:
Position Summary
Handling daily financial and accounting function leading to timely monthly and year end closing for a portfolio of legal entities. Incumbent will report to Senior Finance Manager and Senior Accountant based on the assigned portfolio.
Job Responsibilities
Maintain full set of accounts i.e. General Ledger (GL), Accounts Receivable (AR) Ledger, Accounts Payable (AP) Ledger, Cashbook etc
Ensure entries and journals are FRS compliance and company operate within the statutory compliance and tax regulations
Ensure fixed assets are properly tag and maintain fixed assets registrar
Plan, coordinate and assist in fixed assets physical count on annual basis and year-end stock count.
Prepare and submit monthly & quarterly management accounts
Prepare annual company budget and analyze variances
Prepare draft tax computation and ensure annual tax filing are filed on timely and accurately basis
Prepare quarterly GST return and to ensure GST payment on time or follow up on GST refund
Assist in other corporate tax matters and liaison with tax agent
Assist in internal and external audits and ensure completion on time
Prepare audit schedules, project costs and expenses breakdown and trend analysis.
Prepare XBRL and ensure filing to ACRA before the statutory deadline
Issue invoices, monitor receipt and ensure AR outstanding are within credit terms with close liaison with operational staff
Perform AP and inter-companies reconciliation on monthly basis
Prepare and circulate AR & AP aging report
Perform monthly bank reconciliation
Ensure payment are properly authorised and approved by the relevant party in accordance to the company's authority manual
Check and ensure staff claim in order with proper supporting documents and proper authorization
Be responsive to accountant, other internal and external stakeholders on their financial and management information requirements
Demonstrate commitment to the review and improvement of system, processes, policies and controls improvements and/or implementation
Other duties as and when assigned by supervisor.
Job Requirements
At least a Diploma in Accounting/ Professional Accounting qualification with minimum 2 years of relevant experience
Good analytical skills and financial sense to evaluate the financial impact
Good understanding of accounting processes and management requirement
Possess strong Microsoft Excel skill in analyzing data and report preparation
Meticulous, ability to prioritize work to deliver results promptly with minimum supervision and guidance
Good interpersonal skills to work closely with operational team
Able to multi-task and to adapt in a fast-paced changing environment.

Handle full set of accounts
Assist in preparing timely and accurate monthly financial and management reports
Handle daily financial transactions
Reconciliation of monthly bank statements
Prepare accounts summary to regional office
Preparation of GST submission
Handle staff claims and reimbursements
Administer all documents in relation and accordance to the invoicing and receipt of payment of debtors
Assist with other ad-hoc finance related projects
Requirements
Minimum Diploma in Accountancy or related field
Candidates must have a positive and cheerful attitude to learn
Candidates must be detail oriented and able to multi task
Candidates who can start work immediately or on short notice will be advantageous
Candidates without prior experience can apply as on job training will be provided
Interested candidates, kindly send your resume to ernestneo@recruitfirst.com.sg. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Rejected profiles will be kept in the database for future more suitable roles.
 
Ernest Neo Sian Wei
R1550457
company_desc:
Grow your company with RecruitFirst!
The business environment today is a highly competitive one, which is ever evolving. Having the right human resource business partner with a strong network of consultants and candidates has become key to the success of industry leading businesses.
RecruitFirst is the fastest growing human resource consultancy in the Asia Pacific. Our mission is 
Helping People Find Better Jobs, and Organisations Find Better People
. We live by this mission by ensuring that the best candidates and employers are connected via the rigorous recruitment processes and extensive database that we are continuously developing.
Be the first to recruit with us and start realising the value-add that we are able to provide to your organisation!
Enjoy the expansive array of human resource solutions and network which RecruitFirst has to offer.
Together with our affiliates, we have operations in 8 countries and 10 cities across Asia Pacific – Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing, Guangzhou, Taipei, Tokyo and Seoul. This geographical network gives us the strategic advantage of acquiring the best candidates to satisfy the human resource strategies of multi-national companies. In addition, with this large network of consultants, we are also able to provide for all your human resource needs, including, temporary staffing, contract staffing, executive search, payroll services, global placement or management consultancy.
